alert.note: Alert for De Kalb; Kane; Lee; Ogle (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 4:51AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Lee, Ogle, De Kalb and southwestern Kane Counties through 545 AM CST... At 449 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking scattered strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mount Morris to near Paw Paw. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to some outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... DeKalb, St. Charles, Geneva, Sycamore, Campton Hills, Rochelle, Genoa, Byron, Oregon, Mount Morris, Polo, Shabbona, Hampshire, Elburn, Cortland, Davis Junction, Hinckley, Kirkland, Waterman and Hillcrest. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 79 and 114. I-88 between mile markers 61 and 109. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
